scripts.build: npm run build:init && npm run lint && npm run build:js && npm run build:install
scripts.build:init: npm install; rm -rf dist && mkdir dist
scripts.build:install: mv node_modules node_modules_all; npm install --production --package-lock; cp -LR ./node_modules ./dist; rm -rf node_modules; mv node_modules_all node_modules
scripts.package: npm run build && npm run package:pack
scripts.package:pack: rm -f artifact.zip && cd dist/ && [ `ls -1 | wc -l` -eq 0 ] || zip -r --quiet ../artifact.zip *
scripts.test:unit: npm run check:aws && TEST_TYPE=unit npx jest --coverage --testPathPattern=tests/.*unit\.test
scripts.test:integration: npm run check:aws && AWS_SDK_LOAD_CONFIG=true TEST_TYPE=integration npx jest --coverage --testPathPattern=tests/.*integration\.test
scripts.test:acceptance: npm run check:aws && TEST_TYPE=acceptance npx jest --testPathPattern=tests/.*acceptance\.test
scripts.test: npm run test:unit && npm run test:integration && npm run test:acceptance
scripts.check:aws: node -e "require.resolve('aws-sdk')" 2>&1 > /dev/null; if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo 'CHECK FAILED! The module aws-sdk is not available. Please install it globally ($> npm i -g aws-sdk), and set $NODE_PATH properly (probably $> export $NODE_PATH=/usr/local/lib/node_modules'; exit 1; fi
